required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Full-dose Flu Vaccine to Half-dose Flu Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Compare the Immune Response of Half Dose Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine (TIV) to Full Dose

lead_sponsor.agency: U.S. Army Medical Research and Development Command

collaborator.agency: United States Army Medical Materiel Development Activity
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences
Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR)
U.S. Air Force Office of the Surgeon General

clinical_study.source: U.S. Army Medical Research and Development Command

brief_summary.textblock: This study compared full-dose Flu vaccine to half-dose Flu-vaccine during the 2004-2005 flu season.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a Phase II prospective, single-blind to dose, randomized study that compared the immunogenicity of subjects receiving half-dose Fluzone® compared to full-dose Fluzone®, 2004-2005 formulation. 1440 healthy subjects, ages 18-64 years old and not currently indicated for influenza vaccination under the interim ACIP guidelines, were divided into 8 strata based on age, gender, and previous exposure to influenza vaccine, and randomized to receive either half-dose (0.25mL) Fluzone® or full-dose (0.5mL) Fluzone® by intramuscular injection into the deltoid muscle.

primary_outcome.description: Immune response as measured by viral strain specific hemaggluttination inhibition (HAI) antibody levels for subjects ages 18-49
Immune response as measured by viral strain specific hemaggluttination inhibition (HAI) antibody levels for subjects ages 50-64

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed through following subjects' recording of oral body temperature, completion of a 21-day symptom diary; subjects' completion of longer-term follow-up surveys to track respiratory symptoms; and a review of the Defense Medical Surveillance System (DMSS) hospitalization and outpatient medical visits database in order to track ICD-9 codes relevant to flu-like illness.

other_outcome.description: Race/ethnicity data was only collected by age and cannot be separated out by dose as per the other Baseline Measures

arm_group.description: 0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain
0.25ml, 7.5µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinia per strain
0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain
0.25ml, 7.5µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinia per strain
0.25ml, 7.5µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinia per strain
0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain
0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain
0.25ml, 7.5µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain

intervention.description: A/H1N1, A/New Caledonia/20/99; A/H3N2, A/Fujian/411/2002; B, B/Shanghai/361/2002

results_reference.citation: Engler RJ, Nelson MR, Klote MM, VanRaden MJ, Huang CY, Cox NJ, Klimov A, Keitel WA, Nichol KL, Carr WW, Treanor JJ; Walter Reed Health Care System Influenza Vaccine Consortium. Half- vs full-dose trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (2004-2005): age, dose, and sex effects on immune responses. Arch Intern Med. 2008 Dec 8;168(22):2405-14. doi: 10.1001/archinternmed.2008.513.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participants were recruited at the Walter Reed Army Medical Center Allergy-Immunization Clinic, the Fort Belvoir DeWitt Allergy-Immunization Clinic and the Pentagon Health Clinic during the annual influenza immunization program.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrollment was expanded to include subs with a history of flu vacs. From the originally enrolled subjects (1316), the final data analysis includes only members of the baseline re-vaccination population (1114).

baseline.population: FCSR didn't report baseline demographics per arm they were presented by age group.

group.title: Full Dose, Age 18-49
group.description: Previously Vaccinated Subjects Receiving Full Dose Aged 18-49 Years

group.title: Half Dose, Age 18-49
group.description: Previously Vaccinated Subjects Receiving Half Dose Aged 18-49 Years

group.description: Previously Vaccinated Subjects Receiving Full Dose Aged 50-64 Years

group.title: Half Dose, Age 50-64
group.description: Previously Vaccinated Subjects Receiving Half Dose Aged 50-64 Years

outcome.title: Immune Response: Age 18-49
outcome.description: Immune response as measured by viral strain specific hemaggluttination inhibition (HAI) antibody levels for subjects ages 18-49
outcome.population: From the 1263 subjects enrolled, final analysis includes baseline re-vaccinated subs who fit all inc/exc criteria and whose serum specimens were usable. Data summarizes the differences in influenza strain specific serologic responses according to vaccine dose and age. Antibodies were measured by Hemagglutination Inhibition. GMT=Geometric Mean Titer

group.title: Age 18 - 49, Full Dose
group.description: 0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine): A/H1N1, A/New Caledonia/20/99; A/H3N2, A/Fujian/411/2002; B, B/Shanghai/361/2002

outcome.title: Medical Events: Unsolicited Adverse Events
outcome.description: Assessed through following subjects' recording of oral body temperature, completion of a 21-day symptom diary; subjects' completion of longer-term follow-up surveys to track respiratory symptoms; and a review of the Defense Medical Surveillance System (DMSS) hospitalization and outpatient medical visits database in order to track ICD-9 codes relevant to flu-like illness.
outcome.population: Of the original population, 1203 previously vaccinated subjects completed the 3-day post vaccination side effects diary and have been included in the this analysis.

measure.title: Medical Events: Unsolicited Adverse Events
measure.description: Assessed through following subjects' recording of oral body temperature, completion of a 21-day symptom diary; subjects' completion of longer-term follow-up surveys to track respiratory symptoms; and a review of the Defense Medical Surveillance System (DMSS) hospitalization and outpatient medical visits database in order to track ICD-9 codes relevant to flu-like illness.
measure.population: Of the original population, 1203 previously vaccinated subjects completed the 3-day post vaccination side effects diary and have been included in the this analysis.

outcome.title: Race/Ethnicity Baseline Measure
outcome.description: Race/ethnicity data was only collected by age and cannot be separated out by dose as per the other Baseline Measures

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity Baseline Measure
measure.description: Race/ethnicity data was only collected by age and cannot be separated out by dose as per the other Baseline Measures

reported_events.desc: Of the original study population, 1203 previously vaccinated subjects completed the 3-day post vaccination side effects diary and have been included in this analysis. AEs were collected with diary cards, health surveys, and VAERS forms and listed by subject Grading of AE's: 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe, able to work; 4 = Severe, lost productivity; 5 = Life-threatening; 6 = Fatal

group.title: Full Dose
group.description: 0.5ml, 15µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinin antigen per strain Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine): A/H1N1, A/New Caledonia/20/99; A/H3N2, A/Fujian/411/2002; B, B/Shanghai/361/2002

group.description: 0.25ml, 7.5µg Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine) hemagglutinia per strain Fluzone® (Aventis Pasteur inactivated influenza vaccine): A/H1N1, A/New Caledonia/20/99; A/H3N2, A/Fujian/411/2002; B, B/Shanghai/361/2002

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Swollen lymph nodes in neck, sore throat, chills, body aches
Outbreak of HSV on face, also nasal lesions
Pain in right antecubital area after venipuncture
Tingling in fingers of vaccinated arm

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
